sentences.sentence: Washington sends soldiers to NATO allies in Europe amid fears of Russian aggression on Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: ground over ever-growing fears that Russia could invade Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Last week Washington promised an additional 3,000 soldiers to defend NATO members against any aggression.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Troops arriving this weekend will be spread across Romania, Poland and Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Poland will receive the largest chunk of those 3,000 men.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: 1,700 of those will join the 82nd Airborne Division, already in station.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The US has also sent military aid to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: On Saturday it arrived by plane at Kiev's Vorospil airport, including ammunition for Ukraine's front-line defenders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: On the Russian side, two long-range supersonic missile bombers completed a four-hour patrol mission in Belarus' airspace, according to the Russian defence ministry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Moscow denies it is planning an invasion of Ukraine, and instead accuses the West of plotting provocations in the country, citing the UK's delivery of weapons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This hasn't stopped Russia from flexing its own muscles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Footage shows the scale of Russia's deployment of military troops and resources along the Ukrainian border and in Belarus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: According to US officials, Russia has assembled at least 70 per cent of its military firepower, giving President Vladimir Putin the option of launching a full-scale investment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Secretary General of the United Nations Antonio Guterres has told leaders in China that he expects the organization to be allowed to make a credible visit of the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Guterres made this comment in Beijing to the Chinese foreign minister as part of his visit of the Winter Olympics. His request also included a real view of Xinjiang, where there are allegedly thousands of Muslim minorities incarcerated in re-education camps.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So far, China has denied Michel Bachelet, the UN human rights chief, an independent visit to the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But activists and lawmakers are still eagerly awaiting a report on the matter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: China's leader, Xi Jinping, has expressed his desire for enhanced cooperation with the organisation, but he has also urged critics to stop politicising the games.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The parents of Rayan Oram, a five-year-old Moroccan boy trapped in a well for four days, spoke to the country's King, Mohammed VI, by phone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Despite a huge rescue operation, Rayyan's death was announced soon after he was taken out of the well on Saturday night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Rescuers tried to reach the boy, who had fallen 32 metres through the well's narrow opening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Vatican opened its first embassy in the United Arab Emirates.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Archbishop Edgar Penapara, the substitute of the Vatican's Secretary of State, travelled to inaugurate the diplomatic post.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Vatican established diplomatic relations with the United Arab Emirates in 2007.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The UAE does not currently have a resident ambassador to the Holy See present in Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Pablo Picasso's iconic Guernica tapestry returned to its place of honour at the United Nations on Saturday after a year-long absence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Earlier last year, Nelson Rockefeller Jr., who owns the Guernica tapestry, notified the United Nations of its intentions to retrieve it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Rockefeller said in a statement on Saturday that the tapestry was being returned to the United Nations on a loan basis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Queen has said she wants Prince Charles' wife, Camilla, the Duchess of Cornwall, to be known as Queen Consort when the Prince becomes King.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In a letter to mark the 70th anniversary of becoming Queen, she wrote that it was her sincere wish for Camilla to take the title, following speculation that she might have been referred to as Princess Consort.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Sunday marked the Platinum Jubilee of the Queen, the first British monarch ever to have reached 70 years on the throne.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: While some events took place on Saturday to celebrate the occasion, Sunday is expected to be a quiet and private day, with the Queen reflecting on the death of her father, King George VI.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Charles and Camilla married in 2005 and were both divorcees, with Charles previously being married to Princess Diana.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The statement removes all barriers to Camilla taking on a full role as Queen one day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Dozens of brightly colored hot air balloons took to the skies over the Chilean town of Pe√±aflor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Just 20 winners of a raffle were able to board free flights for more than 50,000 people who applied.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: JOSE PINAR, There are two things in the world that do not leave people indifferent, he says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The photo of a baby and the photo of a balloon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Anyone who sees a balloon looks up, takes a picture of it and comments on it for the rest of his life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It makes such an impact on the unconscious.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Flying in a balloon is almost atavistic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: You know where you take off, but not exactly where you're going to land.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's exactly a life lesson.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We know where we come from, but not where we're going.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Although only 20 people were released to the winds in the balloons, a few hundred people took captive flights in which the balloons remain anchored 50 metres above the ground.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It was also the chance to win one month's training to be a hot air balloon pilot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Internationally renowned surfer Kelly Slater has won the 2022 World Surf League's Billabong Pro Pipeline title in Hawaii.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: With 11 world championships under his belt, this latest win came just a week before his 50th birthday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He defeated local favourite 24-year-old Seth Monis with a near-perfect score.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It was the eighth win for the surfing legend at Pipeline, and it comes 30 years after his first victory. He has hinted that he might now retire, but either way, this latest title comes as a great gift for his birthday on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The annual Italian Sanremo Music Festival came to an end on Saturday with duo Mahmoud and Blanco being crowned overall winners.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Their song, Brevide, meaning shivers, was always the bookmakers' favourite to win the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: competition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And they later confirmed they plan to represent Italy at the Eurovision Song Contest in Turin in May.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Of the 25 participating artists who started the five-night festival, only three made it to the super final round.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: One of those was Elisa with her song O Forse Sei Tu or Maybe It's You.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It was Elisa's second appearance at the Sanremo Music Festival after winning in 2001.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Also reaching the super final was former presenter of the festival Gianni Morandi with his upbeat offering Apre tu Teleporte.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The veteran singer who represented Italy at Eurovision in 1970 came third in Saturday's Sanremo final.
